source.title: Brassicaceae

leads.lead_text: Taproot wiry to stout but not fleshy; fruit less than 8 mm wide, markedly constricted between seeds, valve walls firm
Taproot tuberous and fleshy (radish); fruit more than 8 mm wide, hardly constricted between seeds, valve walls spongy
Fruit 5–8 mm wide, not readily breaking into 1-seeded units; beak more or less linear to narrowly conical, less than 2 cm long; coastal
Fruit usually 3–4 mm wide, readily breaking into 1-seeded units; beak narrowly conical, 1–3 cm long
